issue.title: [C++][Packaging] Move debian/ubuntu/centos packaging off of Travis-CI
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11153](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Per mailing list discussion

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153?focusedCommentId=17318158) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I guess this can happen after 4.0 as well since we have to wait until we can move off of bintray to host these packages anyway. See ARROW-11499.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153?focusedCommentId=17353583) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/billing-overview/#partner-queue-solution
We can use `arm64`, `ppc64le` and `s390x` without credits.
(`arm64-graviton2` isn't free.)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153?focusedCommentId=17366811) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
I tried `arm64` but it doesn't have enough resource to build our packages.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153?focusedCommentId=17421837) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
`[~kszucs]` said that we can still use `arm64-graviton2` on Travis CI. Voltron Labs can sponsor the fee for Travsi CI.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11153?focusedCommentId=17524665) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
We keep using Travis CI because Voltron Labs sponsors the fee for Travsi CI.
